TitleSelect: Science and Technology: "20 Bộ câu hỏi & Trả lời | Exploring the Impact of Science and Technology"
ListenList: What is technology?
Maria says technology is the application of scientific knowledge for practical purposes.
John believes technology is the use of tools and machines to solve problems.
Anna thinks technology is anything that makes our lives easier and more efficient.
What is science?
Maria defines science as the study of the natural world through observation and experiments.
John sees science as a way to understand how things work in the universe.
Anna considers science to be the process of discovering new information about our world.
What is the difference between science and technology?
Maria says science focuses on understanding natural phenomena, while technology applies that understanding to create useful tools.
John believes science is about knowledge, and technology is about using that knowledge.
Anna thinks science explains why things happen, and technology uses that explanation to improve our lives.
What are some of the greatest technological achievements?
Maria mentions the internet, electricity, and the smartphone.
John highlights the printing press, the airplane, and the computer.
Anna points out the wheel, antibiotics, and space travel.
What are the advantages of technology?
Maria believes technology makes life more convenient and efficient.
John thinks technology helps solve complex problems and improve communication.
Anna says technology enhances our quality of life and access to information.
What are the disadvantages of technology?
Maria says technology can lead to dependency and loss of privacy.
John believes technology can cause job displacement and environmental damage.
Anna thinks technology can create social isolation and health issues.
In your opinion, what is the greatest technological invention? Why?
Maria thinks the internet is the greatest invention because it connects people globally.
John believes electricity is the greatest invention because it powers almost everything we use.
Anna considers the smartphone the greatest invention due to its multifunctionality.
What do you think are the three most important or interesting inventions since 1850? How about since 1950?
Maria mentions the telephone, the airplane, and the computer. Since 1950, she thinks the internet, the smartphone, and the microwave.
John highlights the light bulb, the automobile, and antibiotics. Since 1950, he thinks the space shuttle, the personal computer, and GPS.
Anna points out the washing machine, the refrigerator, and the television. Since 1950, she thinks the laser, the DNA sequencer, and the MRI machine.
Do you think pets should be cloned? Why or why not?
Maria says pets should not be cloned because it raises ethical concerns.
John believes cloning pets could be beneficial for research and saving endangered species.
Anna thinks cloning pets is unnecessary and expensive.
Do you think people should be allowed to clone people or organs of people? Why?
Maria believes cloning organs is acceptable for medical purposes, but cloning people is unethical.
John supports cloning organs to save lives but is cautious about cloning people due to ethical issues.
Anna thinks both cloning organs and people should be carefully regulated and used only when absolutely necessary.
What do you think about GMO (genetically modified organisms) vegetables? Is it better to use natural food although it might not produce as much or should we use GMO crops?
Maria prefers natural food because it's safer and healthier.
John believes GMO crops are necessary to meet global food demand.
Anna thinks a balance should be struck between using GMO crops and natural food.
What do you think about GMO farm animals? Would you eat pork from a GMO cow?
Maria is against GMO farm animals due to health concerns.
John would eat GMO pork if it’s proven safe and sustainable.
Anna is cautious but open to GMO pork if it provides benefits.
Are you willing to pay more for food that is really organic? How much more?
Maria is willing to pay 20% more for organic food.
John is willing to pay up to 10% more for organic food.
Anna would pay about 15% more for organic food.
What do you think robots should be used for?
Maria thinks robots should be used for dangerous tasks and repetitive jobs.
John believes robots should be used in manufacturing and healthcare.
Anna thinks robots should assist in household chores and elderly care.
Do you think robots will cause unemployment (loss of jobs) in the future or make more work? Why?
Maria believes robots will cause unemployment as they replace human jobs.
John thinks robots will create new types of jobs and industries.
Anna believes robots will initially cause unemployment but eventually lead to more specialized job opportunities.
Do you think using cell phones too much is bad for our physical or mental health? Why?
Maria thinks excessive cell phone use is harmful to both physical and mental health.
John believes moderate cell phone use is manageable, but excessive use can cause problems.
Anna thinks cell phones are useful but can be harmful if not used responsibly.
If you could copy your brain for future generations, would you?
Maria would not copy her brain due to ethical concerns.
John would copy his brain to preserve knowledge and experiences.
Anna is undecided but leans towards not copying her brain.
How do you think face-to-face communication differs from communication using computers?
Maria believes face-to-face communication is more personal and effective.
John thinks computer communication is convenient but lacks emotional depth.
Anna says face-to-face communication builds stronger relationships.
What social changes have cell phones made?
Maria thinks cell phones have made communication faster but less personal.
John believes cell phones have increased connectivity and accessibility.
Anna thinks cell phones have changed how we interact and socialize.
What are good and bad points of using computers?
Maria says computers increase efficiency but can be addictive.
John believes computers improve productivity but can lead to security issues.
Anna thinks computers enhance learning but can cause physical health problems.

seo.Title: Exploring the Impact of Science and Technology
seo.metaTitle: Science and Technology: "20 Bộ câu hỏi & Trả lời | Exploring the Impact of Science and Technology"
seo.metaDescription: Discover the significant impact of science and technology on modern life, including technological achievements, the role of science, and the balance between innovation and ethics.

contentArray.content: Exploring the Impact of Science and Technology

The interplay between science and technology shapes our modern world in countless ways. From groundbreaking technological achievements to ethical questions around cloning and GMOs, understanding these topics is crucial. Studying the impact of science and technology helps us navigate the benefits and challenges they bring to our lives.
